data.title: Yonkers – Kiwanis Division of Bronx
data.text:
Yonkers

Yonkers, New York

Chartered: November 11, 1929

Officers:

President – Ralph J. Vasami – [email protected]

Secretary – Erin Anderson – [email protected]

Treasurer – Sandy Demirdjian – satanek.demirdfian@mynycb

Meetings:

4th Wednesday at 6:15 PM at Mamma Assunta Ristorante

20 Columbus Avenue, Tuckahoe, NY 10707

Follow us on FACEBOOK and LINKEDIN.

Service Leadership Programs:

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club sponsors three service leadership programs: the K-Kids at Paideia School 24, the Key Club at Saunders High School, and the Aktion Club at SAIL at Ferncliff Manor. Our club advisors mentor and guide the members of these clubs while members take an active role in selecting club leaders, choosing service projects, and making decisions related to club activities. Service projects include fundraisers, clothing drives, sock drives, and food drives, and more. Our goal is to help today’s youth become tomorrow’s leaders through service to others.

Service Projects:

Teacher of the Year Awards

The Teacher of the Year has been our signature project since 1954. The Yonkers Kiwanis Club, in cooperation with the Yonkers Board of Education and the Mayor’s office, formally acknowledges three teachers (elementary, middle, and high school levels) who demonstrate excellence in their profession, actively contribute to the school community and participate in activities that promote student growth and development.

The Herman B. Fine Scholarship

The Herman B. Fine scholarship is in honor of a former member and past president of the club, who made a considerable donation to the club to start the awarding of scholarships in 1978. Eligible high school seniors attending a public school in Yonkers must demonstrate scholastic achievement. merit, need, and community service. The recipient of the scholarship is awarded $1,000.

The Dorothy Burke Literacy Project

When Kiwanis member Dorothy Burke retired in 2002 as a second-grade teacher at Paideia School 24, she wanted to give back to the students. Dottie helped our club raise funds to purchase and donate summer reading books for the second graders. Resource books were also given to the classroom teachers. This program continues today but after Dottie’s passing in 2021, this valuable and longtime project was renamed “The Dorothy Burke Literacy Project” in her honor.

The SMILE Program – SAIL at Ferncliff Manor – PBIS

The School for Adaptive and Integrative Learning (SAIL) at Ferncliff Manor is a private residential school for children with developmental disabilities in Yonkers, NY. The school’s signature Positive Behavior Interventions and Supports program (PBIS) functions on the pillars of its SMILE ideals (Show Respect-Model Behavior-Recognize your Integrity-Learn Safely and Expect Greatness. Throughout the year, students earn credits to spend at the SMILE store, which is stocked yearly by select donations from Yonkers Kiwanis Club.

Club Events:

Mark your calendars for Saturday, May 11th! Join us for the best breakfast in town as you support us in raising critical funds to deliver our community programs and increase our club’s impact!

– Admission Tickets – $15.00 per person, full breakfast buffet!

– Basket & 50/50 Raffle Tickets – 3/$5.00, 7/$10.00, 15/$20.00

– Reduced memberships for potential new members

We look forward to spending the morning together with our guests. What a great treat for mom just before Mother’s Day!

– To RSVP, please contact: [email protected] or call (914) 841-0456.

– Corporate sponsorships are available.

– We will enroll any new page followers (after 3/20) and people who share our event posts in an event day raffle, no ticket purchase necessary!

We are proud to present our Aktion Club’s Winter 2024 Backpack Fundraiser.

Our club raised critical funds to enhance campers summer experiences at Kamp Kiwanis. Thank you to our dedicated club!

#YonkersAktionClub

Happy Birthday to Us!

Interested in becoming a member?

If you would like to become a member of our club, please use this link to download an application form. Thank you.

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club Joins Team Kiwanis! Bronx-Westchester South Division for the Walk to End Alzheimer’s

October 1, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club participated in the Walk to End Alzheimer’s today with Team Kiwanis! Bronx-Westchester South Division at the Westchester Community College Campus. Our team raised $1,174 for Alzheimer’s care, support, and research.

Last Meeting of the Administrative Year – Recognition Dinner

September 20, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club celebrated the end of the administrative year at Mamma Assunta Ristorante in Tuckahoe, New York. President Ralph Vasami thanked all members of the club for a successful year. After sharing highlights of the year, he also acknowledged the following individuals for their contributions:

Kathy Ennis – Chairperson of the Smile Store at SAIL at Ferncliff Manor Committee

Mary Anne O’Donnell – Chairperson of the Dorothy Burke Literacy Project

Judy Bartunek – Chairperson of the Teacher of the Year Award

Pat Saich – Chairperson of the Membership Committee

Erin Anderson – Treasurer, Chairperson of the Flapjack Fundraiser Committee, Club Advisor for the Aktion Club

Dr. Ida D’Ugo – Secretary

Join Us as We Celebrate the Best Breakfast in Town!

Aktion Club Book Drive

Please join our division on Sunday, October 1, for the Alzheimer’s Walk with our banner passing lunch immediately following at the Cabin Restaurant in White Plains. The walk is also in need of 4 to 6 volunteers to staff the “Kid’s Zone”. Volunteers should arrive around 10:30 a.m. and will be chaperoning the area, face painting, bracelet making, etc. This is a great opportunity for SLP members. The Alzheimer’s Walk has been a tradition in our division for many year. Let’s make this happen!

There are two ways for division members to participate in this event:

Option 1: Participate in the walk

Option 2: Volunteer at the Kids’ Zone

Please RSVP to our Lt. Governor by September 22, 2023.

Installation Ceremony for the Aktion Club

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club held an installation ceremony for the six new members of its Aktion Club on August 16, 2023, at SAIL at Ferncliff Manor. The event was facilitated by Erin Anderson, Treasurer, supported by Ralph Vasami, President.

The Yonkers Aktion Club was chartered on May 9, 2023, and is sponsored by the Yonkers Kiwanis Club. The Yonkers Aktion Club is the first Aktion Club in the Bronx Westchester South Division. It is a membership club with a mission to provide service to the community. Also, Aktion Clubs are the only service club for adults with disabilities with more than 12,000 club members worldwide. The club’s goals are to deliver four service projects during the 2023 – 2024 administrative year.

Join us in supporting our Aktion Club in this endeavor!

Scholarship Celebration Dinner

June 22, 2023

The members of the Yonkers Kiwanis Club along with the members of the East Yonkers Kiwanis Club honored their scholarship recipients at a combined celebration dinner representing the importance of education held at Mamma Assunta Ristorante in Tuckahoe, New York. For the Yonkers Kiwanis Club, Denise McKinney, Chair of the Scholarship Committee, introduced Samuel Roque and his mother, Sima Narvaez, and awarded him the Herman B. Fine $1,000 scholarship assisted by Ralph Vasami, President. For the East Yonkers Kiwanis Club, Nancy Shaw, President and Lt. Governor-Elect, introduced Nirel Ayertey and awarded her the Lynn Tishman $1,000 scholarship assisted by Ron Volino, Past Lt. Governor, and Marcy Gattucci-Lentine, Club Advisor.

Congratulations and best wishes for our honorees!

Teacher of the Year Honorees

June 15, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club, in cooperation with the Yonkers Board of Education and the Mayor of the City of Yonkers, formally acknowledges teachers who demonstrate excellence in their profession, actively contribute to the school community, and participate in activities that promote student growth and development.

The recipients of the Teacher of the Year award for the 2022 – 2023 academic year are the following:

Elementary School Teacher: Lauren Spagna, Grade 5, Las Hermans Mirabel Community School

High School Teacher: Jessica Lynn Ford, Science Grades 9 – 12, Barack Obama School for Social Justice

Congratulations to our honorees!

K-Kids Club Beautification Project

June 14, 2023

The Paideia School 24 K-Kids Club along with their Club Advisor, Bryan Boyd, worked with Pre-Kindergarten and Kindergarten students on a Beautification Project for their school.

Teacher of the Year Dinner

Join us as we celebrate our honorees on June 15!

Club Members, please bring your checks or payments on the evening of the event. Thank you.

Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation – Take Steps Walk

June 4, 2023

The Connecticut/Westchester Chapter of the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation hosted its “Take Steps” event at Manhattanville College on Sunday, June 4, 2023. Every step taken and every dollar raised helps to promote awareness, fund research for cures, and support all those who are afflicted by these diseases. The Yonkers Kiwanis Club raised $300 for this cause.

K-Kids Club Butterfly Project

May 18, 2023

The Paideia School 24 K-Kids Club along with their Club Advisor, Bryan Boyd, worked with Pre-Kindergarten and Kindergarten students to teach them about the life cycle and metamorphosis of butterflies.

May 13, 2023

The best way to start a day is with a good breakfast with friends and family. This was definitely evident at our Flapjack Fundraiser held today at Applebee’s Bar and Grill on 2 Executive Blvd., Yonkers, New York. Thank you to all who attended and made this event a great success!

Governor’s Visit on April 30, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club joined other Kiwanis Clubs in the Bronx Westchester South Division for the Governor’s Visit at JC Fogarty’s in Bronxville, New York. During this luncheon, Governor Joel Harris acknowledged Legion of Honor Recipients and Legion of Merit Recipients from the various clubs. In addition, new members were inducted into the Hartsdale and Mount Vernon Kiwanis Clubs. Governor Harris also shared information related to his project on Crohn’s and Colitis through the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation. His wife, First Lady Helene Harris, presented information on her literacy project and how to support it by putting up a Free Little Library, supplying books for a library, and reading to others.

Spring Flapjack is this Saturday, and we are excited to celebrate at the “Best Breakfast in Town”!

Event Information

April 27, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club dinner meeting was a busy one. Beth Jabick, Manager, Fundraising & Volunteer Engagement from the Connecticut/Westchester of the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation, facilitated an informative and engaging presentation on the Foundation. We learned much about these diseases, the Foundation’s focus areas, and the work it is doing to research cures and improve the quality of life of people who are affected by these diseases. The title of the walk, “Take Steps”, captures the essence of the Foundation’s goal – taking steps to find a cure.

The presentation was followed by the induction of our new members by Ralph Vasami, President; and Patricia Saich, Membership Committee Chair: D. Herrera, O. Herrera, and L. Huntt, Jr. We welcome our new members to the Yonkers Kiwanis Club family!

Guest Speaker – Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation

Beth Jabick, Manager, Fundraising & Volunteer Experience from the Connecticut/Westchester Chapter of the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation, will be sharing information about the Foundation’s areas of focus during our dinner meeting on April 27 at Mamma Assunta Ristorante in Tuckahoe, New York. Join us to learn more about what the Foundation does to seek cures and improve the quality of life of those afflicted with these diseases. For more information, contact us at [email protected].

March 18, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club joined the celebration of Irish heritage as we marched in the Yonkers St. Patrick’s Day for the first time this year with members from the East Yonkers Kiwanis Club and Riverdale Kiwanis Club. Approximately 30,000 people lined Mclean Avenue to watch the parade.

Club Members

March 9, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club held its “St. Patrick’s Day” dinner at Mamma Assunta’s Ristorante in Tuckahoe, New York. Our guest speaker was Mr. James Landy, Executive Chairman of Hudson Valley Holding Company and Hudson Valley Bank. In addition, he holds many other positions including Chairman of the Hudson Valley National Foundation, Chairman of the Board of Trustees at St. Joseph’s Medical Center, Chairman of the Board of Stewards of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in Westchester County, Chairman of the New York Bankers Association, and Director of both the Sacred Heart Housing Corp. and St. Joseph’s Housing Corp. Needless to say, Mr. Landy is a very active member of our community.

Mr. Landy shared the rich history of the parade as well as interesting facts about the history of Yonkers. Our club will be reliving part of this history as we march in the Yonkers’ St. Patrick’s Day Parade on Saturday, March 18, at 1:00 pm.

March 7, 2023

The Paideia School 24 K-Kids Club members and advisor, Bryan Boyd, dropped off socks from their Sock Drive to the YWCA located at 87 South Broadway in Yonkers, New York. The K-Kids Club worked with the My Brother’s Keeper Program to collect socks for men, women, and children in homeless shelters. Socks are one of the most needed items for people living in poverty. Great job Paideia School 24 K-Kids Club members and Mr. Boyd!

February 26, 2023

The Bronx Westchester South Division of Kiwanis International held its inaugural “Women in Kiwanis Celebration Brunch” at the Wicked Wolf Restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York. This event celebrated the contributions of women members in improving communities for children. Kiwanis International was founded in 1915, and women were invited to join in1987. Women in Kiwanis continue to make strides in assuming leadership roles thus becoming role models for other women. Celebrate International Women’s day on Wednesday, March 8, by using the hashtag #EmbraceEquity.

February 25, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club held its first “Koffee with Kiwanis” event at the Grinton Will Library in Yonkers, New York. Visitors had the opportunity to learn more about our club and how we improve our community, one child at a time, while enjoying a cup of coffee with club members.

February 16, 2023

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club dinner meeting was a busy one with a special program on service. Guest speakers included Key Club Presidents, Isabel-Aldani Diaz from Saunders High School and Moni from Yonkers Middle High School, and Andrea Vazquez founder of Feed the Need. The Key Club Presidents spoke about their completed service projects (i.e., food drives, clothing drives, collection of medical supplies for Ukraine, Blood Drives, and much more) and those in the planning stages. Ms. Vazquez shared information on her organization that prepares bagged lunches and care packages for the homeless with help from Yonkers Public School students. These lunches and care packages are distributed in Getty Square in Yonkers.

If you are tired of the wintery weather and dream about being on a tropical island, or just want to escape from crowded areas; the dinner meeting held on January 18 was the place to be. The Yonkers Kiwanis Club hosted a program on Antigua and Barbuda sponsored by the Antigua & Barbuda Tourism Authority-USA for its members and guests. Marilyn Pires, Business Development Manager NE, presented many interesting facts on these islands related to its 366 public beaches, watersports, land activities, traditional cuisines, and hotel accommodations. This paradise offers something for everyone!

December 8, 2022

December 6, 2022

Our club welcomed the holiday season at a dinner held at Mamma Assunta Ristorante in Tuckahoe, New York. In addition to celebrating with fellow members and friends, our newest members were officially inducted by President Ralph J. Vasami: S. Demirdjian, M. Gattucci-Lentine, and K. Yurczak. President Vasami also presented Mr. Steve Topilnycky, Coordinator for Toys for Tots Westchester, with toys donated by our club.

November 19, 2022

Never underestimate the power of a good breakfast with friends and family. This was definitely evident at our Flapjack Fundraiser held today at Applebee’s Bar and Grill on 2 Executive Blvd., Yonkers, New York. Thank you to all who attended and made this event a great success!

November 10, 2022

The Kiwanis Family Divisional Dinner was held at Angelina’s Restaurant in Tuckahoe to honor the members and advisors of the Service Leadership Programs sponsored by the Kiwanis Clubs in the Bronx Westchester South Division. The Service Leadership Programs are for all ages and promote community engagement, service, leadership, and global citizenship. Kiwanis members who are veterans were also honored at this dinner for their years of service to our country. The event was hosted by Fordham University.

October 27, 2022

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club celebrated the installation of its new officers for the 2022 – 2023 administrative year: Ralph J. Vasami, President; Ida M. D’Ugo, Ed.D., Secretary, and Erin Anderson, Treasurer. Many fellow Kiwanians and esteemed guests attended this event. During the installation dinner meeting at Mamma Assunta Ristorante in Tuckahoe, Ralph Vasami was also presented with the Kiwanis Pediatric Trauma Center (KPTC) Fellow Award by Joe Corace, President, KPTC.

October 24, 2022

Nor rain nor the cold temperatures kept Team Kiwanis from participating in the Walk to End Alzheimer’s on October 2, 2022. To date, Team Kiwanis has raised $1,495.44. Donations will be accepted for this cause until December 31, 2022. Thank you to all who have contributed to make a difference!

December 17, 2020

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club collected new and gently used coats and jackets to help keep Veterans warm this winter. Viviana DeCohen, Director of the Mount Vernon Veterans Agency, accepted the donations from Kiwanis members John & Judy Bartunek. This project is ongoing.

October 18, 2020

Yonkers Kiwanis presented the Kamp Kiwanis

“Honor An Essential Worker” Award to

Empress Ambulance ServicesMichael Minerva and his staff of EMS workers were thanked for their service and dedication during the ongoing Pandemic.

Click HERE to read the article

October 6, 2020

The Yonkers Kiwanis Club purchased items for the “Coats for Kids” program at ANDRUS Children’s Center. The donation was accepted by Talaya Johnson-Murphy.

Thank you to Beverley Linton and Rocco Riti for assisting with the shopping. It warms our hearts to be able to bring warmth to those in need this winter. Read Article HERE

July 20, 2020

July 16, 2020

We gave out books to the children receiving “Grab & Go” meals. Tom Flammia was at Scholastic Academy School 18 while Olivia King, Wendy Hollander and Judy Bartunek were located at Martin Luther King, Jr. School. There were many masked smiles and gratitude from the parents and children.

June 21, 2020

Breakfast is served!!! We treated the Ferncliff Manor staff to a Dunkin Donuts breakfast. A “sweet” way to say Thank You for their dedication and service to the children during these difficult times.
